text:
We went for dinner at 7pm. A menu was provided to us at 7:15 and a lady came to take order at 7:25. None of the items we wanted to have were available. We were tired after a long day of travel and decided to take from items that were available. 

Went to wash hands. There was no soap and no toilet paper in the restroom. The food was served without utensils. The food was okay but not adequate for the price. After we had finished dinner, we were given the check with wrong pricing. Gratuity was added on the bill for four. 

In summary, the experience was very disappointing.

This place has gone down A Lot! The prices are going up (now, buffet to go is almost $15..used to be $13. There is no gyros in the buffet, last time no chicken Tikka in buffet, time before no beef, one time fly kept going in salad..seriously, keep your selection a buffet...disappointed..not worth going to anymore.
Best halal food in Vegas ! It's one place me and my husband make a point of eating at every time we visit. Service is amazing too. A must try for all.

The KK is more than OK...it's fantastic!! They have a large menu and all the dishes ever tried have been delicious! Strongly recommend the Chili Chicken and Lamb Sharwma.  Kabob Korner is now my new go to Pakistani Food Stop!!

Woww..big disappointment!!
Good things: veg pakora and lamb kabab.
Not good things: 
Didn't even serve water.
Chicken curry was tasteless 
Very limited options 
Rice is not good and no biryani.
No naans but just pita bread
Yelp timing says, opens at 11 am but it's actually 11:30

We couldn't complete what we had in our plates. Wouldn't recommend this if you want to energize ur taste buds.
Great food (I tried cheese burger and chicken wings) and extraordinary customer service.  A must if you are in Vegas and hungry.

Visited this place during 8/1/15 - 8/2/15 

I just hope the owner reads this and learn a lesson or two. 

Here are some negative points. 

- Bad BAD customer service 
- Quality is not maintianed
- Drinks are supposedly self service 
- No plates offered
- No Sauce offered
- No Utensils offered
and SO much more! 

LEARN THIS !

- Welcome your guests with a freaking SMILE!
- Before the food arrives - Serve plates and utensils
- Keep smiling if customer is re ordering even if its near closing hours. YOU ARE SUPPOSE to serve them until you close ! OTHERWISE PUT A NOTICE. 
- wash your dishes properly!
- IF A CUSTOMER WANTS TO SPLIT THE PAYMENT BETWEEN CC and CASH, ACCEPT IT! we are in 2015 not 1915 ! 

This is going to be a LONG review to please bare with me if you care or else dont!

Here's a little background - I visited this place with my friends back in April. As we were exhausted, I didn't really pay attention to the details. Food was great (especially BEHARI Kabab) loved it. 

Now to the recent experience. 

Went to Vegas from LA with my buddies. The entire time I kept bragging about this place to my friends and how this place has most amazing behari kababs ever. 

Yelp states that they close at 11 Pm. - I called them at 10:05 and spoke to a nice gentleman who said yes we are open till 11 pm. I repeatedly asked him if they could serve us Behari kebabs in specific. He obliged and said YES (REPEATEDLY). We left our hotel and while on the way, I called again just to make sure. He then again said YES (REPEATEDLY). I was well satisfied and was looking forward to it. 

10:30 - We got seated. 
The host gave us 4 Menus and said "we can only serve chicken biryani, chicken karahi, and any of the burgers" 
My reply: I just spoke to someone and asked specifically about the behari kababs. 
Host: NO
My reply: I called twice!
Host: Let me check *he goes back in the kitchen and checks for god knows what*
Host: Ok yes, if you had ordered us then we coould have made it but sorry we cant now.
My reply: What are you talking about ? I just spoke to him 10 mins ago How can he not make it now? 
Host: Yea he cant.

I was so frustrated at his blunt  and not to courteous responses. I was about to stand up and leave. 

Somehow he put aside his ego and said "ok we will serve you 1 plate of behari kabab' 
1 PLATE? LIKE I dont get it. but anyhow. I said ok and we ordered rest of the food from that 'restricted menu' 

ONLY reason this place gets a star from me is because of their taste. YES it tastes GOOD! No doubt about it. It is overpriced by a huge margin but arent they all? 

Next day - I decided to give them another try. This time, we went for Lunch. around 3 Pm. 

This experience was going to be rather worse, I would have not imagined it. 

I called in advance again and asked specifically about the behari kabab.
Host "yes its available"
Me "Can I place an order ? I'll be there in 15 mins"
Host: "yes absolutely"
I ordered my food and got there in 20 mins. 

Host "Yes your order is being made and should be out very soon"
Me "Thank YOU!" I was quite excited !

My order arrived 45 minutes AFTER I was seated. So 45 minutes plus the 30 mins advance notice I gave them. ARE YOU SERIOUS? They seriously tested our patience. FOOD WAS HORRIBLE - OVERCOOKED. 

Most terrible experience EVER! 

NEVER AGAIN!

This place was at Freemont St in downtown, now they moved here. 

Same great taste. Try Philly cheese steak.

We came here with family for lunch. Firstly, service was terrible and so was the ambiance and seating. It took very long for simple meals to come. The waitress would keep coming and tell us  5 minutes and the food still wouldn't come for over 15 mins. In total, we had been waiting for over an hour for a couple cheese burgers. When you're a family with a hungry baby and senior citizens, you NEED food to come out. In the end, the food was not very good. Nobody was happy with their dishes and we all left unhappy as we wasted about two hours at the restaurant. The only thing we liked was the Philly cheese steak.All in all, it was a bad experience. On a separate note, we were not welcomed into the restaurant, nor were we offered any drinks or menus until later. It is also probably important to note that we are usually not picky and critical about these things.


We later found out that there were only TWO people working in the entire restaurant, including the chef. Which is why everything was so slow. But why would a restaurant only have two employees???

This was my favourite eat out place in downtown Las Vegas.. they closed down some time back was pretty sad.. but they opened in this new location.. hurraaay .. very spacious, extra seating in the patio idea is awesome..spacious and romantic...they have retained the old favourites + added a lot more in the menu.. Way to go, delicious food and with great customer service..

TERRIBLE SERVICE. Worst dining experience ever. our food took an hour to come out after we had ordered, and that too, not all of it at once. we ordered 6 naan to eat our food with (we were 7 people) and no naan came out until 10 mins later. the waitress brought out ONE naan and 15 mins later brought out ONE more. by this time all our food was cold and nobody was able to eat anything. and to top it all off, right at the end she let us know that one of the dishes we had ordered and were waiting for was not available. if she had told us at the beginning we might have been able to order something else. not to mention they do not give you any complimentary water, just $4 water bottles which makes no sense at all. we ended up leaving without finishing our food. I do not recommend this place solely due to their horrible service.

We're the only ones in the resturant, and the service was bad. 

I ordered Chicken Tikka Masala, and I got chicken tikka.

They have the worst service ever.

The Super Gyro Pita is insanely delicious. Definitely the best gyro I have had in Vegas. The lamb is so tender and well seasoned. Everything down to the onions is perfect. Fresh toppings and they don't skimp on the feta or tzatziki. The hummus was also very fresh and flavorful.
Food was ok. Horrible service. Server stood there.  Never picked up empty plates or refilled drinks. Had to wait and ask for the check.

Was in town for a CTIA convention so tried this place and i have to say the food quality and quantity was great and great service too. Highly recommend you stop by if your visiting las vegas and looking for a great meal!!!

Decided to try this place since I read good reviews and sounded like what I was in the mood for. I was greeted immediately upon walking in and the gentleman, who turned out to be the owner, was super nice and very helpful in helping me decide what to have. I knew I wanted to try the beef Tikka and he told me if I wanted a little variety I could have anything in combination with each other. At his suggestion I went with the chicken boti  kabob. That really was an excellent suggestion as both were amazing and incredibly flavorful. I'm glad I was the last one there because I believe I may have been making faint grunting noises as I demolished the whole plate along with the hummus he made fresh for me just because I mentioned that I liked it during our conversation. I'll be back on the regular just to try the rest of the menu!

We were the only customers here on a Friday night. It took over 10 minutes to get our drinks and 30 minutes to get our meal.  The waitress never checked in on us during our wait.  When we finally got our drinks the fine glasses were taken away and we were given plastic cafeteria style cups.  When I inquired why I was told they were for decoration only.  Although the service was poor the food was Delicious. Food this good should be paired with exceptional service.  To top it off they add an automatic 15% tip to all dine in orders. You mean I MUST pay for poor service? I would consider going back for the delicious food, but for take out only.

Horrible customer service, I ordered food over the phone and when I got there they didn't have my order, so i reorder again for my whole family, waited for more than an hour, they missed my order again, they even didn't apologize, I was 10 years customer and I am not going there for sure. If you have time to waste and leave hungry after an hour then go to this place.

I was disappointed with my latest visit to Kabob Korner.  I have been to the downtown location many times but this was my first time eating there since they moved to the new location.  I had the Chicken Gyro - no onions and my friend had the regular Gyro - no onions.  Both arrived with onions and hers had small black plastic in the food.  Not sure how she had plastic in her dish but that's definitely what it was. (Maybe a plastic bowl chipped?)  She is a pretty good sport so she sent it back for another gyro and the next one was plastic free.  The service was not great and the pricing has definitely increased since the last time I was there.  $12 for a chicken gyro w/fries and a can of soda is just way too much.  (That was before the tip)

Food was very delicious. Little bit of a wait but well worth it because food is made fresh. Customer service is very friendly. 15% gratuity included on all dine in. Had the chicken boti shish kabob and it was very tasty. Would come back again :)

Visiting Vegas again. Wanted some Mediterranean food. Found this place on yelp. Reviews were mixed. I've learned to make my own judgement. This place as great service and awesome food. Had their buffet items were limited but the flavor was huge. Chicken tiki was delicious. Lamb was absolutely the best. I've had Mediterranean but this was the best. If you are traveling to Vegas it's a great place to come and have some lunch buffet.
great food i love this place i recommend the chicken kabab    the service its great they make you feel like you are home everything i tried was good and the place its nice and clean .

The food is DELICIOUS! We ordered a behari kabob roll, goat karahi, and boneless chilli chicken with rice and salad and it was all very tasty! The host Arham was polite, kind,  prompt, and accommodating. As soon as we entered the restaurant, immediately he was at our service, and for a better atmosphere he directed us to sit outside. The restaurant is clean and has a nice romantic touch to it. Several times Arham would check in with us and refill our glasses. I also requested Arham to change the music and he listened and took immediate action. When the food arrived, we were so overwhelmed and we thought we wouldn't be able to finish it, but we finished every single bite. The naans were mouth watering and the chilli chicken was heavenly and the behari kabob wrap was amazing! Overall, it was a great and a wonderful experience. Arham and his team were WONDERFUL!! WE WILL COME AGAIN!!! :))))
Good food, good portions for the price. Very reasonable. Clean atmosphere. Very quiet when I came in. Customer service was very friendly

Loved the food! Service was even better. Portions are very big. Reasonable prices. Easy to find parking.
Great host. Must visit when you're in Vegas.
First off I love Mediterranean food and this place was no disappointment. The food was excellent & we tried several different things.
I realy enjoyed the eating pakistan food , this pakistans foods was way better the others pakistans restaurants food in vegas , ? will vizit again when ? come to vegas .
Kabob Korner tradition once in every week! My philly and fries! Reasonable price:-) fresh and marinated with a little bit spicy!

here food is really good. and customar service really nice. 
i like to go there so many times.

This restaurant is awesome! They have completely revamped their buffet and they have new options to choose from, including lamb. The food looked good and tasted even better. The  staff was very polite and accommodating. The owner himself came out and asked how everything was. I like what they have done with the place and me and my friends will definitely be back. I highly recommend this restaurant to everyone who wants some good Mediterranean food.
A+++
Horrible service! Terrible! And the worker watches you eat the while time. Just standing around watching you eat is not ideal if you ask me.

Amazing food especially the chicken and beef kabobs and chili chicken. went to this restaurant 3 days in a row while my stay in Vegas. The customer service is outstanding as well. Would highly recommend :)
Food is not consistent and prices go up and down based on the cashiers which are probably pocketing the difference
Service and food were both great! I would definitely return here. Down to earth and the food seemed authentic.

Been a loyal customer here since they had their little shop in downtown. Stuck with them even when they switched to a finer location. Stuck with them even when they raised their prices because the food and service was always consistent. However I went in today and was thoroughly disappointed. Not in the food but with the fact that they don't serve water with your meal. I don't get it.... Is this a new trend? If I go into a restaurant and spend 40-60$ the least I can get is a cup of nice refreshing water with my meal but instead i have to continuously buy water bottles which are priced at 2$ a pop. I'd be more understanding if it was a fast food chain and its but your own water but the fact that this location should be more "upscale" would incline me to believe that I get a ice cold cup of water with my meal. The only reason I give it two stars is because their chili chicken is alway consistent and great tasting. However as far as the hostess well she kind of just sits there. There's no "hello" or "welcome".
Good customer service, poor atmosphere, food OK but very overpriced for what you get. I paid $22 with tip for a plate of Masala Chicken and rice with water. Not going back.

Restaurant name and exterior signage implies that they serve Mediterranean food and are located on a corner. Neither of these things are actually true. During lunch they offer a buffet, but during dinner hours, the main menu has a handful of Mediterranean dishes (falafel app, shawarma plates and pitas) but is mostly Indian dishes?

It was a challenge to order a basic Greek salad with protein, because there was a language barrier and the cashier was unfamiliar with the menu. Every question I asked, he would take to the kitchen staff for an answer, then come back still unable to answer my question.

My simple order for a Greek salad ($9 on menu, no description, apparently w/o protein?) plus lamb was rang up as a shawarma plate ($14) and all sides were substituted for the salad. No dressing, flatware, napkins, or pita were included with my takeout order. Tasted just fine but definitely overpriced.

This spot should consider a name change to reflect that the namesake kabobs and Mediterranean cuisine do not describe the  majority of the menu offerings.

NOTE: menu states all dine in orders are charged 15% service fee. Maybe if staff were trained, you wouldn't have to force customers to tip.
Great food and service!! Very authentic...nice spot to eat and enjoy a fast meal while on the go.

This place is shady as shit, don't go here. The food was alright, I had the goat biryani which was ok except that the menu price didn't match what I got billed for. Apparently somewhere in the menu, it also mentions the fact that there is automatic gratuity which is always lame and shady. If you order water, you get a bottle of water from the grocery store which they charge $2 for. Finally, they only have one young woman working at the front and one person in the back so obviously it was slow service. They won't be in business for much longer, don't help them in the meantime.
Really good food and great service!!! We had the beef tikka kabob and beef nihari. Very flavorful and delicious.

I ordered chicken tikka special since i used to like it from their pervious location and this time serving came in a weird way chicken tikkas were in a separate dish rice and salad in a  separate square bowl. Its so very awkward and uncomfortable. They should have kept all in one big plate. Hope they ll realize soon since its a new setup. Rice that came with it wasn't fresh at all it was microwaved from a yesterday or a day before. Servers are so so. Knockout burger was $8 with just a burger in plate no fries or any sort of side to go with that. Although i don't expect a lot from Desi Restaurants but it felt a little less.
The tikka kabob was amazing. My kids really enjoyed eating outside and loved the food. The service was good, waiter was very nice.

Absolutely love this place... Amazing service and food. Been coming here for 3 days in a row lol and can't get enough of their burgers (especially coming From LA) where good halal burgers are rare. Can't wait for you guys to branch out to LA.
I ordered the chicken kabob and the chicken like substance served felt.more like a.sausage. It tasted ok.  Price was cheap. Wouldn't recommend.

This place was recommended to me by a friend as the Greek place in Vegas.  That is the understatement of the decade! I got there a little bit after closing but they still served me the best Greek food I've ever had in my entire life and I am 45 years old!  I strongly recommend that you get the Chicken Tikki Masala with a side of long grain rice!  If I could give this a 10 star review in a five star review I would.  It was super fresh with a base of curry and the chicken literally melted in my mouth! I was wondering if I have died and gone to Greek  heaven!!!  This was my first time in here but it will not be my last for sure.  I work right down the street from this place so now I will frequent it at least once or twice a week!!!  I think I want to try everything on the menu now ... and I probably will eventually!!!

  out of

This place didn't even pop up when I searched for nearby restaurants as I am staying at a hotel less than a 5 minute walk.  I was on my way to the Chinese place next door when I walked up to the buffet sign.  I walked in and to take a peek at the line and stayed.  Most indian buffets I hit mainly serve chicken.  Not this place.  Goat and lamb were also being served!  I went back for more tandoori chicken, which was super moist, and chicken tikka.  Both were delish and the naan came out hot and fresh!  Can't wait for another trip to be back!!

First time here, the waiters seem really stressed and overworked although they are very friendly you can tell that they are barely keeping it together, kind of feel bad for them. But the main issue with this place is the wait time for the food . I came in right around 8:15  and was seated, I had the lamb shawarma plate. I didn't receive my food till 9:00. 45 min was way too much time, I only complained once though, and my food came out after that. But there were a lot of mad customers who were also waiting too long for their food and complaining. Time is money . As far as the food goes, the lamb shawarma was ok not great, pretty oily and kind of salty imo, rice was ok, and the "house salad" is just like two slice of a tomatoes a couple slivers of onions, on like 5 pieces of lettuce. The one star is for actually getting my food. 12.99 for the lamb shawarma I don't mind, but u get reemed on the can of Coke that is 2.50 yes a can not a fountain drink, that is what made me mad. Oh also watch out for the 15% gratuity that's automatically added to the bill. I woulda tipped more but hey they did it for me. This place has potential, but needs a lot of work in getting the food to the customer on time. Shoulda just gone to mint India bistro next door.

Went there because it was within a walking distance from where we were staying. The service itself was nice but it was the worst hummus I have ever tried. We had Chicken and Beef kebab and those were okay. I would not go there again unless I am really starving to death around there.

We tried other Pakistani/Indian food restaurants and I have to say that this food is not impressive but it's not that bad either. I was not amazed by the food. It's not spicy at all so if you don't like spicy food this place might be better for you. The customer service was okay, same thing as food, not great.
Great food loved the buffet and I got a burger as well! I'd reccomend anyone in the area to try it out very relaxing and ambient atmosphere and food to match

Horrible service. Waited 40 minutes for the food to arrive. While waiting server didn't bother to ask for water. When I asked for water brought a small water bottle later it was charged in bill for $2. I ordered lamb karahi. Full of onion and bones in the gravy. No lamb.. I cook better food than what I was served. Never going again.

The staff is incredibly prejudice. Other customers who sat down after us had their order taken and food delivered before we even had our order. Other tables were offered water and our table was always skipped. The food is decent but the service is disgusting. No tip and definitely no return
Must try this place is really good, affordable and nice atmosphere very nice people as well.
This place just sucks. Food was terrible. Service was even worse some how. Just skip it all together.
Ali sahib and his wife are my good friends. This is my favorite restaurant. All the food is delicious. Try the gyro, biriyani,kebabs and aloo ghobi. It's the best.

The lunch Buffet was great. All the Mediterranean/Indian food you want and it tastes great , too.  The service is awesome. The tandoori chicken was very flavorful , unexpectedly flavorful. The beef was well cooked and also tender.

don't waste your time bcuz internet prices are so affordable  but when you go in the restaurant every thing almost double prise its big time rip off and service food and waiters are sucks ! This is such a bad experience and waste of money !!

Found out they were under new management so I figured I'd give them another chance. In past the service was awful with extreme long waits for food, and food was basically just adequate. Well the place looks the same but that's about where the similarities end.  First time I came i decided on nihari and chicken tikka masala with naan. The food was DELICIOUS, and no skimpy naan - naan was huge and tasted like back home in Karachi. Next time tried tikka and Chana masala and both high quality. I came in the weekend and had their knockout burger - wow. The new owner really is putting a lot of effort in quality of food. Keep it up. You've got a regular customer.

Absolutely love love love the Chicken Boti Kabob! We have been going here for years now, when it was downtown and the new location. Super far now but well worth the drive. The owner, I think it's him, is so nice and remembers us every time we see him. Food is great! I totally recommend this restaurant.

I only tried this place out because someone told me I should try them out for a quick bite to eat and they are halal...So I decided to order online and to place my order. Once the order was placed I saw that you had to pay online to complete the order. I go to pick up my order and the guy Chris I believe that's his name said that the payment online didn't go through and I had to swipe my card. The purchase also came up different than it was online. Ok come to find out both purchases was taken out for the same order!!! I called the store right away and was told that I could either get a credit at the store for the amount(no thank you) or solve the matter on my end basically telling me to take care of this issue on my own...No effort what so ever...The tone was more like it was my fault for ordering online...Which now I see as a .I am so disappointed because my family and I love to eat at places that serve Halal food and I will not go back nor refer anyone too bad...I will not speak ill about tgis place, but if someone asks me I will be honest.My quest continues on for Great Halal places and customer service...As for the food I was a bit upset so I really cant speak on the taste...But if a place doesnt have good customer service then it ruins the whole experience. Not Happy...Oh and yes I did solve the matter on my end and got my money back..

same great chef, same great taste,quick service and ambient atmosphere. kabob korner has been reborn and its on its way to becoming the best gourmet restaurant across the strip, preparation takes a minute but when its ready the food is perfection, they used to be on fremont, since then they've changed the game with an all new menu, fine dining, and an out door, italian style patio coming soon. if you're a foodie you have to try the chilli chicken.

We used to go to the Downtown location for their great food and reasonable price. The owners (a couple) used run the store themselves. We would often chat with them too. 
This time I was in Vegas, I saw online that they moved into a new location. I went there and was shocked. A Hispanic girl was serving and no sign of the old owners. I asked the server if they had a high chair for my toddler and she said they did but it was broken. May be I should have left at point but was too hungry and tired after driving over 600 miles that day. Things only went south from here. 

We saw the menu, and everything is severely overpriced. While were sitting, no water was served. My wife asked for water pointing at my toddler child, and the server brought in just one cup of water! Are you kidding? So we don't get water unless we specifically ask for it? I went to the restroom and there was no soap in the restroom! 

While ordering, I wanted the beef biryani but she said they didn't have that. Then I asked for the Bihari kabob and she said they didn't have it either. Majority of the items listed on the menu were not available. I don't recall if I ever went to a restaurant where they had a menu but the items on the menu were not available. She pointed me to only few items on the menu that were available. We finally ordered few items (not what we wanted) and sat there for a while. They finally served the food. The food was very bland and average - especially for the price. When we finally got our check, the check had more items than I actually ordered - the bill was much higher than what it would have been. I told the server about the issue and she then corrected the check. They added 18% gratuity on the bill and with the poor service I didn't want to pay any additional tip. When I gave her back the signed credit card receipt, she didn't look happy. I guess she expected additional tip in addition to the 18% gratuity. 

The old owners most likely have sold their business to someone else. The new owner has no idea how to run a business and employs servers with no training to run this place. 

Do not be fooled and stay away from this place. I will never return.
First time trying this place and it was a wonderful place. The food was outstanding and the customer service was very friendly and not a phony friendly either. I would return to eat here again.
This has now gone from my least favorite halal place in Vegas to one of the best. Not sure if management changed or what but keep it up!

1-Worst customer service
2- Dirty plates served clearly had to tell them plates were dirty with food residue. The employee cleaned it with tissue.
3-Ordered chicken biryani but the rice was really hard and rice was re warmed again. Very unhygienic dirty restaurant. 
4-They bring silverware in normal tissue ridiculous.
5- Stay Away from this restaurant
I asked for the owner or the manager but was refused as the server stated "I cannot give you their name or their contact".
I did not get any type of apology from them. Shows you how bad this restaurant is. Also will seek out to State of Nevada in regards this

Ate here for the first time. Am here for my real estate convention, looking for Zabihah Halal food before I get forced into eating vegetarian food for the next few days at the convention. It was late Sunday night,  but this place was open. Looks like a hole in the wall place,  but has good service and everything is prepared fresh (so it does take a little longer).

I like to go eat here every weekend but sometime I don't have time to sit n eat and they charge $14 for buffet Takeout which is $8.95 regular price. I don't know why they charge $ 5 extra for takeout buffet. That's the big down side for me and yes they are very very slow if you want quick lunch don't go there specially on weekends. They made me wait for 15 min for lamb and after waiting they replace lamb with some chicken item. They usually do this so no surprise. Food is good yes but need to think twice before we go eat there.

What a sea change 
New owner Lalil know his game well
We had a early dinner 1. Tandoori chicken and 2 chili chicken 
Both dishes were amazing served with portion of rice and salad 
Tandoori beats the chili chicken for me, superb flavor 
Highly recommend this spot, go check it out

REALLY bad service. Zero Customer service. Zero courtesy from the staff. I don't know how this place got to 4 stars. It's definitely a lie. Service sucks. Waited for my order for more than 45 minutes and it was over cooked and burnt. Every item is over priced. I would not even give it a single star. Never going back again.

Menu says "Best Gyro in Vegas," and actually, it just might be--thick slices of tasty seasoned meat, onions, lettuce, tomato, and homemade tzatziki sauce--delicious. Manager was super friendly too. A great place to eat!

I can't believe I've been missing out every time I came to Vegas! 

This time I came to Vegas I made sure to stop by Kabab Corner. It seriously is amazing. The owners are so genuine and caring! The food was just so delicious, and I had the Chili chicken and chicken shish kabab, it was worth it! My husband had a zinger burger and it was one of a kind. 

The prices are affordable and the setting is amazing!

Had a great meal here. The service was great. They guy who I think is the owner was very friendly and generous. Liked the food. Good decor. Would definitely consider coming back if I visit Vegas again.

Zero Star Review

I ordered a veggie biryani and a falafel gyro sandwich.

Not worth the price and the 15? default gratuity.

Food/Service both sucked!!

I dream about this place. We are from Utah and we have been coming to this place for 4 years. We love the chicken tikka (dry). You can't go wrong though. We have met the owner and he is such a nice guy. He actually cares about his customers and the service they get.
Good foods and 5 star service philly steak and tikka was awesome but biryani was ok but no complaint

We ordered chicken shwarma and chicken tikka. Both were amazing in taste. The food was very good in amount. Rice used in both the dishes was of good quality. This is an authentic indo/pak restaurant. I will definately be going back to this restaurant again.

My goodness this place is GOOD!!! I found this spot through restaurant.com and I can say that I'm pretty pleased! 100% Zabiha Halal, and this is the first time I'm not getting ripped for halal meat. The owner is such a sweetheart, he cares about his customers! Also the servers gave my party (20 ppl) bottled waters (on the house)! The chicken zingy burger is delicious and their chaat is off the hook! The biryani is pretty good (decent for the middle easterners lol) 
Definitely recommend!

Worst place to be here! Orders are not taken right! The owner goes five times in the back to check if the food is available or not they are not sure what they are serving on the table. How are you running a restaurant with bad customer service and no food! Also everything we ordered is unavailable. Not recommend  place also be aware of their gratuity charges it's a rip off!

Came in from Chicago for a convention and found this place on zabiha.com. The place is nice and neat but nothing special to look at. We ordered a burger, tandoori chicken, and sweet lassi. Everything was excellent. We went back the next day and ate there again. Good food again. Also this place is quite close to the las Vegas strip which is convenient if your from out of town and staying at the hotels.
One of the best Mediterranean food In Vegas. Flavourful, yummy and really delicious. Out of all the awesome food we tried philly steak sub was the best, mourn watering..

We usually visit this restaurant on our Vegas trips. A halal restaurant which has been in business for a number of years.
Service has definitely improved!! We ordered double cheese burgers, beef samosa and sweet lassi.
Sweet lassi gets 5 stars. One of the best lassi's I ever had. 
The burger was a decent size and very juicy.
The beef samosa is a rare find so definitely worth it. Good filling and spicy too.
They also had kabobs and other Indian dishes on their menu.

Parking can be tight.

Kabob Korner... where should I start. It's a tough choice when a place is so well rounded. From the moment you walk in you are pleasantly surprised by a beautifully finished restaurant which includes a very comfortable and relaxing outdoor lounge. They offer some of Las Vegas' finest hookah, and trust me, I know good hookah. The menu has something for everyone, from kids to picky eaters, and vegans to meat lovers. I've had the Super Gyro Pita, the Spicy Zinger Burger, Chicken Tikka and the Chicken Shish Kabob, all of which were executed perfectly. The balance of flavorful ingredients in all their dishes is so consistent I would fearlessly order anything on the menu with complete confidence it would be just as delicious as the last. There is even a pool table available to use at no additional charge, it takes its place in the outdoor lounge, making this place great for casual lunch, a fun night with friends, a relaxing dinner with family, etc. To top it all off though, the service is fantastic, they are; attentive, welcoming, and very kind servers. I'm sitting in the restaurant writing this review and they didn't even have to ask which hookah flavor I'd like, they already knew, I am proud to say that I have become a regular at the Kabob Korner.

Seriously terrible service!! So I ordered this place on Uber Eats, and moments after my driver left, I get a phone call from the restaurant stating that they gave my driver the wrong meal. The man said I could either keep this food or come get my order. Being that i was only a couple minutes away, I happily said that I understand mistakes happen, and I'll be there shortly. About 3 mins after I hung up, he called AGAIN to ask me if I was on my way!! When I got there, he gave me the correct meal then had the nerve to ask if I brought the other one back with me! When I told him I didn't bring it with, he threw his head back like he was upset! Excuse me for thinking someone else wouldn't want the food that they already delivered to me and that we had opened to check it? Anyways, after making the trip over there after they had messed up my delivery order, the least he could do is be appreciative that I wasn't upset when I got there. Definitely didn't leave there in the same forgiving and optimistic mood as I was in when I arrived.
The chicken was good, but service is bad. Was not acknowledge or greet. The knots were brunt and didnt not taste as good. Probably would not come back

I don't even know where to start. 

I used to be addicted to Kabob Korner since its days in Downtown LV. This was my go to place for some awesome halal burgers & many of their platters. Now, it's a place that I go to when I am desperate for some food or TRULY craving a halal burger. 

Today, I ordered a chili chicken platter & the famous knockout burger. I wouldn't even complain about the price of the platter if it was decent, but I can't even give it that much credit. The presentation of the platter was GREAT, but the taste? Not so much. It was displeasing to my tastebuds and I could not believe the quality of the food had dropped to such a level. It's astonishing. 

The famous knockout burger, on the other hand, was relatively decent. If I do decide to eat something from this place, it'll most definitely be one of their American styled burgers. 

Seating is incredibly nice (LOVE the choice between being seated indoor & outdoor).

I had the lunch buffet. The rice tasted day old or worse. There was a decent variety of dishes, but none of them were good. None of the food tasted fresh except the fruit and the cream for desert. I really regret eating there.

Service is awesome. Decent parking lot, buffet is little over priced but the non-vegetarian food is delicious. Decent choice on strip of Vegas for people who don't have time to wait in long queues at nearby restaurants.

I have eaten here three times. 

The restaurant is intimate, quiet, and relaxing. It could do with dome interior upgrades, but the service is always good. Not too inquisitive but they pay attention to the customers. 

My favorite dish to date is the chicken burger. It is absolutely amazing. The patties are made from shredded chicken breast meats. The spices compliment the meat extremely well. It is very juicy. If you eat anything you MUST try the Chicken burger. 

On my next visit I tried their Philly cheesesteak. It was every bit as good as the chicken burger. It was well flavored, the bread was fresh, and it was very filling. 

The third trip was all about the Cheeseburger. It was excellent as well. With all of the burger and gourmet burger spots in Las Vegas, I have yet to find a cheeseburger as tasty as this. It is better than Habit Grill, Bachi Burger and Guy Fieris. 

This little restaurant is a hidden gem in Las Vegas.
This place is a nice little gem just off the strip. The lamb Gyro was fantastically good, and it was some of the best lamb I've ever tasted. The service was pretty good too.

Service was extremely slow, Kabobs do not even come on skewer or contain vegetables. Their definition of a kabob is an underwhelming stick of meat camouflaged in carbs to hide that fact that it is an unsatisfying life choice.

Again went back and excellent food!!
Löve this place.
The staff gives great service!!!
Will go back to kabob korner
Amazing customer service and food! Better than other nearby Pakistani restaurants! Chili chicken, subs and other Tandoor items are great.

Buffet is good. Service is not great. Been here a few times. Price was inexpensive. Inexpensive food with poor service is acceptable. Price was recently hiked up quite a bit. For the price (Now), Mint Bistro right next door is so, much better especially for the service. Please note. If you ask for regular water you get bottled water. Little hidden charges are annoying. The food is still good though.

The best pakistani/indian food in Las Vegas..we eat here once a week..they have the most authentic taste! The only thing they need to improve is get more people for service but they are working on it..I'm a big foodie n i rely on yelp big time so that's why writing this review to help people get the taste of back home n enjoy the best HALAL burgers!

Three words come to mind: Terrible, Horrible, Un-appetizing!!!
Oh yeah, forgot to mention.......horrendous customer service as well.

This place is amazing. Food is fresh and very delicious. Tandoori and kebab are highly recommended. It's very tender and flavorful. The restaurant is shadowed by the Mint restaurant but let me tell you this it's way better than next door restaurant (mint restaurant).If you looking for nice and quite place to have delicious meal this is the perfect place. The owner(young guy) is very attentive and friendly with the service. He recommended us some of the dishes which we loved it. Although the place is not that busy and you have to wait a little bit for your food to come, it's worth it. You will not be disappointed. We have eaten at several restaurants in Las Vegas but this place feeds authentic food. We are so glad that we found this place.

This is essentially for east indians and Muslims and they really use that Mediterranean theme loosely.  The food isnt great but not bad.  There is heat in a majority of the recipes, which i have asked to be cut, but they cant.  The food is very much overpriced considering the cut of meat (bottom shelf) and the sides which seem to consist of lettuce and rice.  However, they do work that meat into magic and create a meal I would consider digestible and even tasty.  They seem to have a vision for this place, that just doesn't meet the level of product they are serving and really lack some basic expectations, when spending money in a business. I gave this business 3 stars because the times I have ordered, eating the food was a pleasant experience and I did enjoy it overall.  For the Muslims this is probably a place you would want to support but if you are looking for Mediterranean food, note to reader, you wont see one olive, spinach pie, grilled olive oil chicken, feta but there is a grilled pita that I enjoyed with a side of butter.

We order 4 lassi then waiters come back and told lassi is not good and he was sorry we order 2 coca cola instead of lassi  but the guy bring us 4 coca cola for sorry about lassi We really got happy for that that's nice bussines also food was great everything was perfect thank you
My new favorite lunch spot. Fantastic lunch buffet for $11.99 with fresh bread brought to your table. Will definitely be back.

Came here for a late lunch today. Visiting Vegas and wasn't quite sure where to go.. this was a very nice surprise? It doesn't look like much but the food is excellent; great quality and taste. We got the chicken boti and tikka beef, both lean and full of flavor with sides of rice, pita and salad. I would give them 5 stars, but for a place that also serves Indian food I was a bit disappointed that they didn't have more sauces (like raita or chutney) for their Naan. 
Would definitely come here again though!! Our waiter was super nice and welcoming.

This restaurant is amazing. The food is very delicious and the owner is very friendly. We tried chana masala and chicken tikka, both were just yummy. I will stop by whenever I am in Vegas for next trade show.

Took a friend here cause they wanted to get some food. While we are waiting I read the menu and I see "best gyro in Las vegas." Knowing myself and the foodie I am, I end up ordering it to go. Ate it at home and I can say it was the second best one I've had so far. Seems like aside from actual Greek festivals, it ranks in the top 3. Must try local spot.
Food is delicious and the waiter was super nice! Fresh food and great vegetarian options!!

After attempting 2 different restaurants for an all Indian/Pakistani cuisine, we found this hidden gem.  Tried the goat Karahi, so tasty. Cheesy fries, mango lassi, chicken tikka masala all hit the spot.  And the waiter Chris worked so diligently to serve us and went above and beyond.  Definitely recommend this place.

Cute little place on East Flamingo near Paradise. 
I only stopped in because the Chinese restaurant next door was closed.
I definitely didn't want a huge dinner plate so I ordered the beef kabob pita sandwich for 7.95(8.63 with tax).
Honestly...I rarely eat this style of food, so I'd say it was good. Not the best, but it had a nice flavor.
I think I should've tried something without all that pita bread. Maybe next time.
Seemed like a risk coming in, kinda empty and wierd looking.  But well worth it just for the lunch buffet. The goat is amazing.  The menu is not what I expected but I am excited to come back.

I came to las vegas for magic show and i found this little  place.
So i m so happy to do that.
Food is amazing.
We have got 
Hamburger
Chicken tikka
Chicken kebap
Beff kebap and we loved them. This is my favorite place in vegas...
Always fresh and piping hot when served. Can't go wrong with the gyro or a good ole cheeseburger. Fries are delicious also. Been coming here for years and the food has always been consistently great.

Good food, good location, good service.

Young kid waiting was courteous.

I'm writing this review to inform people that place is under new ownership and the service and food is great again!!! I have been going to kabob Korner since they where located near Fremont street and I loved their gyros but when they moved to the new location I disappointed the quality wasn't the same. Then I recently found out that they changed owners  so I gave it another chance and I was impressed the lamb gyro and chili chicken both were amazing.

Bro, get the knockout burger!

This place is always part of our vegas ritual.  We always make sure we eat here and get some grub to go.  They specialize in halal fast food and Pakistani cuisine.  Its perfect for families with children.  They also have hookah outside ;).
Food was delicious, my boyfriend wanted to order another gyro and my Chana masala was perfect.  Server Chris was attentive and enjoyable.  We'll be back!
